skill.name: wezterm
skill.description: Control WezTerm terminal emulator via CLI. Manage panes, tabs, workspaces, and execute commands in running terminals.
skill.summary: Control WezTerm terminal emulator via CLI. Manage panes, tabs, workspaces, and execute commands in r...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill providing WezTerm CLI reference material. No executable code, network calls, or file system access is included. Pure prompt-based skill.

content.value_statement: Managing terminal panes, tabs, and workspaces manually is repetitive and error-prone. This skill provides ready-to-use WezTerm CLI commands for automation and efficient terminal workflow management.
actual_capabilities: List all WezTerm panes and clients in plain or JSON format
Split, move focus, and activate panes in any direction
Create, activate, and navigate tabs with absolute and relative indexing
Send text commands directly to specific panes
Manage workspaces and multiplexer domains (local, SSH)
Toggle zoom and control pane display states
limitations: Requires WezTerm to be installed on the system
CLI commands require WezTerm to be running or available in PATH
SSH domain connections require pre-configured SSH targets
Does not provide interactive terminal sessions within the skill

use_cases.title: Automate Terminal Layouts
use_cases.description: Create consistent multi-pane terminal layouts for monitoring and deployment tasks across sessions.

use_cases.title: Manage SSH Connections
use_cases.description: Organize and navigate between local and SSH terminal domains with simple CLI commands.

use_cases.title: Streamline Development Workflows
use_cases.description: Send commands to running panes without leaving your editor, maintaining context and productivity.

prompt_templates.title: List Panes
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all WezTerm panes currently open in JSON format.

prompt_templates.title: Split Terminal
prompt_templates.prompt: Split the current pane horizontally and run htop in the new pane.

prompt_templates.title: Navigate Tabs
prompt_templates.prompt: Activate the next tab and then show me how to go back to the previous one.

prompt_templates.title: Connect to SSH domain
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I connect to an SSH domain called production-server using the WezTerm CLI?

output_examples.input: Show me all WezTerm panes and how to split them
output: ‚Ä¢ wezterm cli list - Show all panes
‚Ä¢ wezterm cli list-clients - Show GUI window clients
‚Ä¢ wezterm cli list --format json - JSON output for scripting
‚Ä¢ wezterm cli split-pane --right -- htop - Split with command

best_practices: Add WezTerm CLI to PATH for simpler command access across all contexts
Use JSON output format when piping to other tools or scripts
Combine pane and tab management commands for complex workflow automation
anti_patterns: Running commands without verifying pane IDs when targeting specific terminals
Using relative tab navigation without tracking current position
Sending untested commands to production panes without confirmation

faq.question: Does this skill work on Windows and Linux?
faq.answer: WezTerm supports macOS, Linux, and Windows. The CLI works similarly across platforms with minor path differences.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for CLI commands?
faq.answer: There are no rate limits for local CLI commands. Use standard shell best practices for rapid automation.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Use --format json output to pipe pane data to jq, grep, or other CLI tools for scripting.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads and displays terminal information. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Commands are not working, what should I check?
faq.answer: Verify WezTerm is installed, the CLI is in PATH, and WezTerm is running if using GUI features.

faq.question: How does this compare to tmux or screen?
faq.answer: WezTerm provides similar multiplexing with a modern GUI. Commands differ but concepts overlap. Use both together.
